plentry.pd:
(0): Default audio profile.
Interactive live streaming: 48 kHz sample rate, music codec, mono, max bitrate 64 Kbps.
Communication:
Windows: 16 kHz sample rate, audio codec, mono, max bitrate 16 Kbps.
Android/macOS/iOS: 32 kHz sample rate, audio codec, mono, max bitrate 18 Kbps.
(1): 32 kHz sample rate, audio codec, mono, max bitrate 18 Kbps.
(2): 48 kHz sample rate, music codec, mono, max bitrate 64 Kbps.
(3): 48 kHz sample rate, music codec, stereo, max bitrate 80 Kbps. To enable stereo audio, call and set audioProcessingChannels to AUDIO_PROCESSING_STEREO in .
(4): 48 kHz sample rate, music codec, mono, max bitrate 96 Kbps.
(5): 48 kHz sample rate, music codec, stereo, max bitrate 128 Kbps. To enable stereo audio, call and set audioProcessingChannels to AUDIO_PROCESSING_STEREO in .
(6): 16 kHz sample rate, audio codec, mono, with echo cancellation (AEC) enabled.

(0): Default audio profile. In live interactive scenes, the sample rate is 48 kHz, music encoding, mono channel, and bitrate up to 64 Kbps; in communication scenes, the sample rate is 32 kHz, voice encoding, mono channel, and bitrate up to 18 Kbps.
(1): Sample rate 32 kHz, voice encoding, mono channel, bitrate up to 18 Kbps.
(2): Sample rate 48 kHz, music encoding, mono channel, bitrate up to 64 Kbps.
(3): Sample rate 48 kHz, music encoding, stereo, bitrate up to 80 Kbps. To achieve stereo effect, you also need to call and set audioProcessingChannels to AGORA_AUDIO_STEREO_PROCESSING in .
(4): Sample rate 48 kHz, music encoding, mono channel, bitrate up to 96 Kbps.
(5): Sample rate 48 kHz, music encoding, stereo, bitrate up to 128 Kbps. To achieve stereo effect, you also need to call and set audioProcessingChannels to AGORA_AUDIO_STEREO_PROCESSING in .
